basics.name: Inyoung Cheong
basics.label: Tech law scholar
basics.Topics: Free speech, Privacy, Generative AI, Large language models, Content Moderation, Platform Governance

education.university: University of Washington School of Law

Washington Journal of Law, Technology & Arts (Submission Editor, 2021-2023)
education.dissertation_topic: Free Speech, Content Moderation, and Algorithmic Decision-making

education.university: Seoul National University School of Law
education.dissertation: Alternative Dispute Resolution and the Right to Fair Trial
Justice Sentiment and Aesthetic Judgment: Immanuel Kant's and David Hume's Moral Theories

professional_experience.summary: Taught "Technology Law and Public Policy Seminar" to 25 J.D. and LL.M. students with a specific focus on algorithms as speech, different notions of privacy, and content moderation.

professional_experience.institution: UW School of Computer Science & Engineering
professional_experience.summary: Advised by Tadayoshi Kohno, have explored collaborative governance models that leverage the expertise and incentives of various stakeholders to promote trust and safety through legal and qualitative methods.

professional_experience.institution: Ministry of Culture, Sports, and Tourism
professional_experience.summary:
Formulated a strategic plan, "Future Technology for Culture & Arts," by gathering the opinions of businesses, researchers, academics, and civil society, leading to a record-setting budget increase ($100 million a year).
Executed art funds for Webtoon and Fashion design. Supported Webtoon (digital comics) artists to formulate the industry's self-regulatory body in a collaboration with major Webtoon platforms.

Interpreted relevant laws, implemented user experiments and coordinated conflicting political views to ensure the successful grant of a license to operate to a public broadcasting channel.
Reviewed bills related to media convergence and digital platforms and drafted over 200 Commission statements about their impacts on users' fundamental rights including free speech and privacy.
Led an investigation into a deceptive advertising scandal involving the leading national newspaper. Upon uncovering evidence of violations, took decisive action by imposing injunctions and fines on the newspaper.

institution.name: Administrative Conference of the United States

professional_experience.summary: Performed comprehensive research on complex case law and statutes, and global regulations on the removal of agency heads and legal implications of automated decisions within the U.S. federal government.

Formulated and cultivated sustainable development goals-conscious strategic regional partnerships, called "UN75 Cities," with South Korean local governments, while directly reporting to the Under-Secretary-General.

Achieved the honor of being one of 100 candidates selected from a pool of 5,500 to pass the national exam.
Undertook a rigorous 6-month law and foreign affairs training and graduated 2nd place out of 100 candidates.
Assisted in curating Jonathan Borofsky's exhibition, "Human Structures and the Light of Consciousness."
